DataElement.preferredName: Immunization Vaccine Route of Administration PCORnet CDM Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.:Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._Designation of the part of the body through which or into which, or the way in which, the medicinal product is intended to be introduced. In some cases a medicinal product can be intended for more than one route and/or method of administration.:Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease._Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._Designation of the part of the body through which or into which, or the way in which, the medicinal product is intended to be introduced. In some cases a medicinal product can be intended for more than one route and/or method of administration._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.:Preparations containing substances with antigenic properties administered to activate the immune system, thereby inducing an immune response._Designation of the part of the body through which or into which, or the way in which, the medicinal product is intended to be introduced. In some cases a medicinal product can be intended for more than one route and/or method of administration.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.

Concepts.definition: Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preparations containing substances with antigenic properties administered to activate the immune system, thereby inducing an immune response._Designation of the part of the body through which or into which, or the way in which, the medicinal product is intended to be introduced. In some cases a medicinal product can be intended for more than one route and/or method of administration.

Concepts.definition: Preparations containing substances with antigenic properties administered to activate the immune system, thereby inducing an immune response.

Designation of the part of the body through which or into which, or the way in which, the medicinal product is intended to be introduced. In some cases a medicinal product can be intended for more than one route and/or method of administration.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Active immunization where vaccine is administered for therapeutic or preventive purposes. This can include administration of immunopotentiating agents such as BCG vaccine and Corynebacterium parvum as well as biological response modifiers such as interferons, interleukins, and colony-stimulating factors in order to directly stimulate the immune system.
